result.execSummary:
The defendant Dre Lon Jerval Sellers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dre Lon Jerval Sellers

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Supervision STATUS ( Missed Alternate Contact)  Report.

Defendant Dre Lon Jerval Sellers in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. 
Pursuant to negotiations and On motion of the State, Court ordered Charge amended to Retail Theft  pursuant to Milwaukee County Ordinance  63.043 to which Defendant plead no contest. 
Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.  Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $250.00 including costs to be paid in 6 MONTHS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Dre Lon Jerval Sellers in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery but no offer. State will send defense an offer forthwith. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot - Wauwatosa
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Dre Lon Jerval Sellers in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Dre Lon Jerval Sellers in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dre Lon Jerval Sellers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dre Lon Jerval Sellers not in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/7/22 @ 2:30p
